subject: Re: [junit] assert failure without exiting test.
msgSnippet: ... Search the web. There are a number of people who have written about this issue. Try multiple assertions JUnit as your keywords. Summary: that s not the
messageBody:
Raja Nagendra Kumar wrote:
> Sorry I did not mean to hurt the group..I wanted to say that none of
> them has responded to this question of mine..One reason could be I have
> not put up my requirements clearly..
>
> J.B I would be more happy if you could you reply to my suggested solution..

Search the web. There are a number of people who have written about this
issue. Try "multiple assertions JUnit" as your keywords.

Summary: that's not the way JUnit was built and the JUnit authors aren't
apologizing for it. If you would like two assertions to pass or fail
independently of each other, then that's two tests and you should write
them as two tests.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
